hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Reset Creates Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a 'liquidity reset' event (20-day BTC realized volatility >80% followed by 10-day volatility <30%), the first breakout from a 7-day Bollinger Band (20,2) squeeze (bandwidth <0.1) has an 80% probability of continuing in the direction of the breakout for a 2:1 reward/risk move over 5-10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme volatility followed by severe compression indicates a liquidity vacuum being filled. The first sustained breakout often attracts momentum flows as directional conviction returns, creating a high-probability trend initiation.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility dropped from >80% to <30% within past 15 days
Price closes outside Bollinger Bands with volume >20-day average
Breakout direction confirmed by 4-hour close outside band

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2x the distance from entry to opposite band

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction reverses within 3 days in >40% of instances, or median return is <1:1 reward/risk.
